alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 1:55PM PST until January 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, highest snowfall near the crest and east of Roslyn. Winds gusting as high as 25 to 45 mph with areas of blowing snow late tonight and tomorrow. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect winter travel across Snoqualmie Pass on Interstate 90.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
